bug.author: kidhasmoxy
bug.summary: Docker Images Require Unreleased Linux Drivers
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
CUDA acceleration is not available when using the Docker images as the Dockerfile was updated to use 20.06-py3, which relies on Nvidia Drivers that not past release candidate/ beta stage. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Attempt to start Docker image and you will see errors on platform support and how only CPU will be supported Output: <denchmark-code>ERROR: This container was built for NVIDIA Driver Release 450.36 or later, but version 440.100 was detected and compatibility mode is UNAVAILABLE. [[CUDA Driver UNAVAILABLE (cuInit(0) returned 804)]] NOTE: MOFED driver for multi-node communication was not detected. Multi-node communication performance may be reduced. Using CPU </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
GPU Acceleration is available on a stable channel released driver. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
OS: Ubuntu 18.04 host GPU Quadro P2000
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Do we need any of the capabilities provided in the latest image or can we revert to the previous one, which depends on the latest stable driver release?
